meanings.definition: To destine to an unhappy fate.
meanings.sent1: The old witch foredooms the young prince to a life of sorrow.
meanings.sent2: She always foredooms her relationships to failure before giving them a chance.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller playfully foredooms everyone to a day without chocolate.
meanings.sent4: His reckless behavior foredooms him to a path of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds foredoom a stormy night ahead.

meanings.definition: To predict or foresee a negative outcome.
meanings.sent1: The wise owl foredooms a harsh winter based on the thickness of its feathers.
meanings.sent2: The pessimistic weatherman always foredooms rain on the weekends.
meanings.sent3: The magic eight ball foredooms a 'no' to all questions asked.
meanings.sent4: Her constant worrying foredooms every situation to end badly in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The creaking floorboards foredoom an unwanted visitor approaching.
